intro: Yucca angustissima subsp. avia, commonly known as the slender yucca, is a perennial plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its tall, unbranched stems and narrow, sword-shaped leaves that are often covered in a whitish bloom. The plant produces tall, branched inflorescences with clusters of white or pale blue flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and resilient member of the Asparagaceae family.
